resources.string:
The app allows the use of some built-in meditation sessions or create custom ones. A meditation session consists of editable segments (add, delete, change order of segments) which have a duration and optional audio linked to them. 
Basically it is a meditation timer. 

Main Screen / Home Screen 
Hub for reaching main functions of the app. 
 * AUDIO LIBRARY: managing audio. 
 * SETTINGS. 
 * CHOOSE MEDITATION: access, edit, create meditation sessions. 
 * PLAY, PAUSE, STOP the active meditation session.. 
 * TOGGLE BUTTON: turns the audio on or off. 

Implementation 
 * for playing audio: MediaPlayer class (MediaController, MediaSession) 
 * for managing audio sources and output: AudioManager class 
 * for built-in sounds: SoundPool class

Manage audio library 
The user can manage / browse media files: 
 * browse built-in textual, instrumental audio files, and bell sounds 
 * BUY button: buy new content, ambient sounds, guided meditations etc. 
 * IMPORT button: import media files (watch folders on the device) 
 * HOME button: go back to main screen 

Implementation 
 * for browsing media: MediaBrowser and MediaBrowserServiceCompat class 
 * for importing media: FileObserver class? 
 * for accessing files on external storage: StorageManager, StorageVolume class 
 * for accessing metadata: MediaStore class 
 * for data storage: ContentProvider class 
 * for selling content: In-app Billing API

Settings 
App settings, like: 
 * volume 
 * mute notifications and / or incoming calls 
 * keep screen on 
 * switch theme 
 * About section 
 * Rate us section 

Implementation 
 * for UI: Preference and PreferenceActivity class 
 * for storing preference data: SharedPreferences interface

Manage meditation sessions 
The user can manage meditation sessions, edit, delete them (long click) or create new ones (NEW SESSION button). A meditation session consists of editable segments (add, delete, change order of segments) which have a duration and optional audio linked to them. 

Implementation 
A session should be some kind of play list, where a meditation segment is an item of the playlist. Sessions must be stored somehow, when selected should be grabbed from the database, set and displayed as the active session in the MainActivity / Home screen.
